name: A Pied Piper
description: Red Alert! Your ship has been attacked by Jodmos--the alias of Captain Benjamin Sisko when disguised as a Klingon. Is this attack related to Neelix's disappearance and possible disguise as another species?
rules:
-- In a Skirmish Event, you will engage in space battles against thematically appropriate foes until the Event's conclusion.
-- There are two Phases to this Event! Each Phase is individually timed.
-- Unique Ship Battle Missions are available during the event. Open the Event to access them.
-- Using any version of Adira, Burnham, Sisko, Waddle, Costumed crew, or crew with matching Battle Traits, will provide a bonus.
-- Using the U.S.S. Excelsior, Hirogen Warship, and D'Kora Marauder will provide a bonus to hull.
-- Every Ship Battle you win earns you Event Victory Points. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock Threshold Rewards!
-- In this event, Squadrons may also compete to advance up the Squadron leaderboards. Join a Squadron to get more rewards!
bonus_text: Crew Bonus: Adira, Burnham, Sisko, Waddle, or Costumed

featured_crew.name: West
featured_crew.flavor: In an attempt to assassinate the Federation President, Colonel West dons the disguise of a Klingon.

featured_crew.name: Burnham
featured_crew.flavor: A malfunctioning holoprogram aboard the wreckage of the KSF Khi'eth made Burnham appear Trill.

rewards.name: Credits
rewards.flavor: Credits are the galaxy's standard currency. Use Credits in the Time Portal to enlist crew members, build items, and more.

rewards.name: Sisko
rewards.flavor: Promoted to Captain, Benjamin Sisko was recognized for his accomplishments as Commander of Deep Space Nine.

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.name: Chronitons
rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

ship.name: Ferengi D'Kora Marauder
ship.flavor: An enigmatic vessel used for battle and transport. Capable of disabling a deflector shield.

rewards.flavor: Use to instantly revive a failed Voyage.

rewards.flavor: ISM, or interstellar medium, is the matter that exists between astronomical objects. It can be manipulated by the Q to facilitate crew retrieval. ISM can be obtained from Daily Log-in Rewards, Campaigns and participating in Fleet activities.

rewards.flavor: Honor is gained by dismissing crew who have served you well, but are ready for reassignment. Redeem in the Time Portal for exclusive crew, special fusion-related items, training programs, and more.

rewards.name: Merits
rewards.flavor: Merits can be earned by completing missions. Use Merits to acquire faction-based rewards, upgrades to your ship, and more.

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.name: West
rewards.flavor: In an attempt to assassinate the Federation President, Colonel West dons the disguise of a Klingon.

rewards.name: Rarity Constellation
rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 5 Polestars: Common, Uncommon, Rare, Super rare, Legendary

rewards.name: ISM
rewards.flavor: ISM, or interstellar medium, is the matter that exists between astronomical objects. It can be manipulated by the Q to facilitate crew retrieval. ISM can be obtained from Daily Log-in Rewards, Campaigns and participating in Fleet activities.

content.reroll_info:
Skirmish rewards are additive. By continuously rolling you receive additional rewards. No rewards are lost by rolling again.
DROP RATES:
Event VP: 13.58%
Time Portal Pack: 0.13%
Chronitons: 11.45%
Honor: 14.11%
Intel: 27.43%
Credits: 33.29%

Skirmish rewards are additive. By continuously rolling you receive additional rewards. No rewards are lost by rolling again.
DROP RATES:
Event VP: 13.58%
Time Portal Pack: 0.13%
Chronitons: 11.45%
Honor: 14.11%
Intel: 27.43%
Credits: 33.29%

screens.text: "Prepare to die, Starfleet petaQ! I shall destroy you using one of your own starships, and I am well-versed in its capabilities. For the glory of Qo'noS, Kahless, and my master!"
"That's no Klingon. That's Captain Sisko, disguised as one. Why he can't remember that is anyone's guess."

"You start digging into Neelix's disappearance, and whether he's disguised as another species, and then a version of a Starfleet officer disguised as a Klingon attacks you? That's no coincidence. Keep him busy while we try and figure this out."
"Prepare to die, Starfleet petaQ! I shall destroy you using one of your own starships, and I am well-versed in its capabilities. For the glory of Qo'noS, Kahless, and my master!"
"That's no Klingon. That's Captain Sisko, disguised as one. Why he can't remember that is anyone's guess."

"You start digging into Neelix's disappearance, and whether he's disguised as another species, and then a version of a Starfleet officer disguised as a Klingon attacks you? That's no coincidence. Keep him busy while we try and figure this out."
